title: 'Disturbing' meal that looks like Freddy Kruger is freaking people out
text:

When it comes to photos of food on the internet, they either look really appetising, or like something the cat dragged in.

There is very rarely an inbetween.

One place where you will see a number of monstrous meal photos is over on the Facebook group, Rate My Plate.

Here diners submit photos of their own culinary creations, which are then rated and slated by other members of the group.

One image on the page has got people talking right now - and it's all because it bears an uncanny resemblance to a horror movie villain.

(Image: Deadline News)

The scary snack created by Mary P was shared on Facebook yesterday, where it began freaking out social media users.

For the dish, Mary arranged meat, cheese and eggs on a plate in the shape of horror movie villain Freddy Kruger.

The creepy creation uses bacon rashers as skin and a hat, with mushrooms for an ear and cheese and red pepper are fashioned into claws.

A twisted smile was also fashioned out of pieces of onion.



(Image: WireImage)

Kruger appeared in the 1984 film A Nightmare on Elm Street.

In the terrifying flick, the character is able to enter his victims' dreams and cause them harm which then follows into their waking lives.

So far Mary's photo, which was captioned "meat you in my dreams" has had over 2,000 likes.

One fellow user described the dish as "disturbing".

They said: "Mary P I find your artistry slightly disturbing!"

Another wrote: "Don't know what's more disturbing, the look of it, or that someone would take the time to think and carry out such a devious scheme."

A third person added: "Everyone choose your words wisely. Clearly this is a cry for help. Not sure where you are from Mary. Clearly therapy seems like a suitable option and maybe a sedative or two."

However not everyone was alarmed by the photo, with some praising Mary's artistic skills.

A different user replied: "You've missed your calling clearly you are an artist of some talent!"

Someone else agreed, saying: "Love it! It's deadly! So cool and creative. Must make it at Halloween ."
description: A creepy-looking meal has unsettled social media users with its resemblance to a horror movie villain
